topic.title: Overview reports
topic.p: Information from project reports is aggregated and displayed in several fields.
This sample project contains the following fields:

list.li: Project name and location. Location is displayed if a project is hosted on a publicly available repository like GitHub.
Date and time of the latest Qodana inspection.
Number of problems detected and severity expressed as a circle. The circle color reflects the severity of the major part of detected problems. You can click this element to open the report.

topic.tip: Projects without uploaded reports can be deleted.
topic.p: This table shows how %product_cloud% interprets and displays several reports (or bars in the bar chart) depending on their metadata.

tr.td: The latest report and overwrites the previous reports

topic.p: To see all reports related to the project, click the project name. This will open the Qodana report page.

The upper part of the report provides a timeline containing the number of problems detected per each inspection. Here, you can examine the absolute number of problems detected, or the number of problems relatively to a baseline.
The report components below the timeline are described in the User interface overview section on the Qodana documentation portal.
